intro: Oxystophyllum subsessile, commonly known as the slender leaf oxystophyllum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
